refsect1.title: Signal Prototypes
refsect1.synopsis: "change-background" void user_function (PanelApplet *panelapplet, PanelAppletBackgroundType arg1, GdkColor *arg2, GdkPixmap *arg3, gpointer user_data); "change-orient" void user_function (PanelApplet *panelapplet, guint arg1, gpointer user_data); "change-size" void user_function (PanelApplet *panelapplet, gint arg1, gpointer user_data); "move-focus-out-of-applet" void user_function (PanelApplet *panelapplet, GtkDirectionType arg1, gpointer user_data);

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The PanelApplet object is an object which encapsulates an applet. It is a GtkContainer which may contain a single widget. This widget, in turn, should contain all widgets exposed by the applet.
A PanelApplet is associated with a BonoboControl. The control makes the cross process UI emmbedding required by applets possible.

refsect2.title: PanelApplet
refsect2.para: The PanelApplet struct contains private data only.

refsect2.title: PanelAppletOrient
refsect2.para: The PanelAppletOrient type specifies the orientation of the applet. The values may seem backward (e.g. PANEL_APPLET_ORIENT_LEFT means the panel is on the right hand side), but this is because the value is representative of the applet's orientation, not the panel's position.

refsect2.title: PANEL_APPLET_ORIENT_UP
refsect2.para: The applet is orientated up (i.e. the panel is at the bottom of the screen).

refsect2.title: PANEL_APPLET_ORIENT_DOWN
refsect2.para: The applet is orientated down (i.e. the panel is at the top of the screen).

refsect2.title: PANEL_APPLET_ORIENT_LEFT
refsect2.para: The applet is orientated left (i.e. the panel is at the right hand side of the screen).

refsect2.title: PANEL_APPLET_ORIENT_RIGHT
refsect2.para: The applet is orientated right (i.e. the panel is at the left hand side of the screen).

refsect2.title: enum PanelAppletBackgroundType
refsect2.para: The PanelAppletBackgroundType enumerated type specifies the type of background of a panel.

listitem.simpara: The panel has no background, the default is used.
The panel has a color, i.e rgb value, background.
The panel has either an image background or is translucent.

refsect2.title: enum PanelAppletFlags
refsect2.para: The PanelAppletFlags associated with the applet are boolean flags which the panel may read in order to figure out how to handle the applet.

listitem.simpara: No flags are to be associated with the applet.
The applet should expand horizontally on an horizontal panel and vertically on a vertical panel - e.g. the behaviour of the Window List applet.

The applet should expand vertically on an horizontal panel and horizontally on a vertical panel. Most applets should set this flag in order to utilise the full panel width and allow the applet to be Fitt's Law compliant.
The panel should draw a grab handle around the applet - e.g. the Window List and Notification Area applets both set this flag.

refsect2.title: PanelAppletFactoryCallback ()
refsect2.para: This callback is invoked when the applet is loaded onto the panel. Typically the callback will check that iid matches and fill the applet with the widgets which make up the applet.
Prior to the callback being invoked the PanelApplet (or an instance of the sub-class specified by the GType passed to the factory macros) is instantiated and initialized.

listitem.simpara: The Bonobo IID of the applet requested.
The data passed to the factory macros.
TRUE on success, FALSE on failure.

refsect2.title: panel_applet_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new PanelApplet. This function is typically not useful as the applet is created before the PanelAppletFactoryCallback is invoked.

refsect2.title: panel_applet_get_orient ()
refsect2.para: Get the current orientation of the applet.

refsect2.title: panel_applet_get_size ()
refsect2.para: Get the current size hint for the panel. The size hint is not useful for most applets.

Note: The return value is not an integer value specifying the pixel size of the panel. Do not use this value to calculate the size of the applet. Use it only as a hint by which to decide the applet's layout.

refsect2.title: panel_applet_get_background ()
refsect2.para: Returns the current background type. If the background type is PANEL_NO_BACKGROUND both color and pixmap will be unaffected. If the background type is PANEL_COLOR_BACKGROUND then color will contain the current panel background colour. If the background type is PANEL_PIXMAP_BACKGROUND, pixmap will contain a pointer to a GdkPixmap which is a copy of the applet's portion of the panel's background pixmap.

listitem.simpara: A GdkColor to be filled in.

refsect2.title: panel_applet_get_preferences_key ()
refsect2.para: Returns the GConf path to the directory containing the applet's per-instance preference keys. Using this you may construct the full path for the applet's preference keys. See for more information.

refsect2.title: panel_applet_add_preferences ()
refsect2.para: Associates each schema in schema_dir with a key in the applet's preferences directory (i.e. the directory returned by panel_applet_get_preferences_key()). Each applet preference should have an associated schema to ensure that the key has a defined type, sane default and documentation.
If you pass NULL for opt_error, this function will print a warning message from any GError which GConf may return.

listitem.simpara: The GConf path where the applet's schemas are installed e.g. /schemas/apps/my_applet

refsect2.title: panel_applet_get_flags ()
refsect2.para: Retrieve the PanelAppletFlags associated with the applet.

refsect2.title: panel_applet_set_flags ()
refsect2.para: Set the PanelAppletFlags associated with the applet. See PanelAppletFlags for more details on the possible uses of these flags.

refsect2.title: panel_applet_set_size_hints ()
refsect2.programlisting: void panel_applet_set_size_hints (PanelApplet *applet, const int *size_hints, int n_elements, int base_size);
refsect2.para: Set a list of desired size ranges for an applet with the PANEL_APPLET_EXPAND_MAJOR flags set. size_hints is an array of (max, min) pairs where min(i) > max(i + 1).
The panel will endeavour to allocate the applet a size in one of the (base + max, base + min) ranges.

listitem.simpara: Number of elements in the array. Not the number of pairs.
The base size of the applet.

refsect2.title: panel_applet_get_control ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the BonoboControl associated with applet.

refsect2.title: panel_applet_get_popup_component ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the BonoboUIComponent used for popup menus associated with applet.

refsect2.programlisting: void panel_applet_setup_menu (PanelApplet *applet, const gchar *xml, const BonoboUIVerb *verb_list, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: Sets up a popup menu for applet described by the xml string, xml. See section for a description of the format of the xml.

listitem.simpara: The xml character string describing the popup menu.
The list of BonoboUIVerbs for the menu.
The user data pointer for the menu.

refsect2.para: Sets up a popup menu for applet described by the xml file, file. See for a description of the format of the xml.

The user data pointer for the menu.

refsect2.title: The "change-background" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (PanelApplet *panelapplet, PanelAppletBackgroundType arg1, GdkColor *arg2, GdkPixmap *arg3, gpointer user_data);
refsect2.para: Emitted when the background of the panel changes. Use type to determine which, if any, of color and pimxap is valid.

listitem.simpara: The object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "change-orient" signal
refsect2.para: Emitted when the orientation of the panel changes.

listitem.simpara: The object which received the signal.
The new PanelAppletOrient of the applet.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "change-size" signal
refsect2.para: Emitted when the size of the panel changes.

Note: this is different for size negotiation which is handled by size_request() and size_allocate() as usual. This signal should be used to determine what font size or widget layout to use depending on the size of the panel. See panel_applet_get_size().

listitem.simpara: The object which received the signal.
The size hint of the panel.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
